alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 9:59PM PDT until May 09 at 11:30AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following county, Okanogan. * WHEN...Until 100 PM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 958 PM PDT, Emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 0.20 and 0.30 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.05 to 0.20 inches are possible in the warned area through Saturday afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Move away from recently burned areas. Additional rainfall could trigger rock slides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
